page.text: Jian Wang, Shuang Luo, Jing Li and Qiang Zhu*
A palladium-catalyzed synthesis of symmetric and unsymmetric 2,2
α-isocyanoacetamides was developed. The reaction was performed at room temperature in air
which acted as the sole oxidant of Pd
. Mechanistic studies suggested that double isocyanide insertion
Acting as an isoelectronic equivalent of carbon monoxide, iso-
cyanide has shown its great potential in palladium-catalyzed
A was considered as a general intermediate in reaction with
various nucleophiles followed by reductive elimination, gener-
heterocycles could be generated by linking a nucleophile to
ate formation upon oxidative addition or C
construction involving isocyanide insertion as a key step
employs bisnucleophiles and isocyanides under oxidative con-
For instance, Orru and co-workers reported an
ﬃcient synthesis of cyclic guanidine derivatives and related
heterocycles via palladium-catalyzed isocyanide insertion with
ﬀerent strategy aimed at construction of heterocycles by
linking a nucleophile to an isocyanide substrate.
acetamides, in which the carbonyl oxygen in the amide moiety
acted as an intramolecular nucleophile, reacted with aryl,
vinyl, or alkynyl halides under palladium catalysis to provide
fied, albeit in very low yield (Scheme 1). In this novel process,
two oxazole rings are formed in one pot through multiple
starting from acyclic substrates. This unprecedented and unex-
pected transformation intrigued us to investigate it in detail.
) direct linked bisheterocycles are of vital
importance in pharmaceuticals, natural products, and func-
are mostly based on heteroaryl ( pseudo)halides and organo-

bisoxazoles were successfully developed by transition metal
of these methods, including high reaction temperatures, using
a stoichiometric or excess amount of Cu/Ag-based oxidant, still
exist. Herein, we report a novel palladium-catalyzed synthesis
homo- and cross-coupling of readily available
This reaction occurs smoothly at room temperature
and uses air as the sole oxidant.
The reaction conditions were screened with 2-isocyano-

Besides piperidinyl amide, a cyclic morpholino analogue of 1a
also generated the corresponding product 2b smoothly in 70%

nately, isocyanoacetamide bearing a benzyl group rather than

CN (1 mL) via a syringe pump in 1 h generated an unsym-

also obtained in 13% and 69% yields, respectively. The selecti-
vity for cross-coupling was better in a reaction of 1c and 1b,
generating unsymmetric product 3b in 63% yield. Unsym-

pump within 0.5 h at 25 °C in air.
ditions: a solution of 1 (0.20 mmol) and 1b (0.6 mmol) in MeCN (4 mL)
was added to the reaction mixture containing Pd(OAc)
via a syringe pump within 1 h at 25 °C in air. Isolated
yields of 2b are based on 1b. Other yields are based on another
A solution of 1a in MeCN (1 mL) was
added to the reaction mixture via a syringe pump within 0.5 h.

tionality was also isolated in 57% yield. The current strategy
ﬃcient approach to both symmetric and unsym-
′-bisoxazoles in one step starting from simple acyclic
α-isocyanoacetamides. It is notable that two heterocyclic rings
are constructed simultaneously at ambient temperature in
open air. Three chemical bonds including two C
–C bond are formed with 100% atom-economy during
This reaction was scalable, as exemplified by sub-gram
diversification of the obtained oxazole product 2h was also per-
formed. Transforming the chloride moiety to boronic acid
ester through palladium catalysis was realized in 89% yield.
The product 4 containing two aromatic boronic acid ester moi-
eties is expected to be a useful precursor for more complicated
2h with phenyl boronic acid also performed smoothly, giving
highly conjugated product 5 in high yield (c).
To verify the reaction pathway, C2 unsubstituted oxazole 6
was treated under the standard aerobic conditions. Most of the
starting material 6 was recovered with no homo-coupling
product 2a being detected, which suggested that 6 was an
unlikely reaction intermediate. Although the role of triphenyl
phosphine was not fully understood, it may facilitate the
process of reductive elimination and stabilize the Pd(0) species
A plausible reaction mechanism was proposed in Scheme 5.
Coordination of the carbonyl oxygen in
ﬀords intermediate I. Deprotonation and the
subsequent isocyanide insertion to the Pd
first oxazole ring in intermediate III. Repeating the same
process furnishes the key bisoxazole ligated palladium(
mediate VI. Reductive elimination releases the homo-coupling
species which is reoxidized to Pd
in air. It is also possible that isocyanide insertion to the
In summary, we have developed a novel palladium-catalyzed
Double isocyanide insertion was believed as a key step in this
transformation. The reaction was performed at room tempera-
ture in air which acted as the sole oxidant of Pd(0). The
resulting symmetric or unsymmetric products were highly
π-conjugated, showing their great potential in functional
This work was supported by National Science Foundation
